awd_abstract_narration: Wesleyan University will continue a five-week, multidisciplinary,               residential Young Scholars project in Chemistry, Physics,                       Biology, Earth Science, Mathematics and Computer Science for 60                 students entering grades 9,10.                                                                                                                                  The program stresses "hands-on" science and mathematics                         experiences, group learning and research, and career exploration                and academic guidance.  Students study with Wesleyan University                 senior faculty, master high school teachers, and role model                     university undergraduates.  The program continues to enjoy the                  support of the state's department of education, the Connecticut                 Pre-Engineering Program (CPEP), and the private sector.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
